page.title: 09THE ABBEY GATEWAY
page.content: The most interesting building in Kingswood is the Abbey Gatehouse which is part of the gateway to the old Abbey. When the Abbey was built, it took up a lot of space, but this was before King Henry V111 knocked it down in 1640. All that was left was the Gateway. Some of the old stones were used to build the Upper School Room, a building at the top of the High Street. The Gateway has houses joined on to it now but it is still a tourist attraction. The key can be borrowed so people can unlock it and look around. The Abbey Gatehouse is now used for meetings of Kingswood Parish Council.
